first_reading.title: Letter to the Hebrews
first_reading.text:
[[He 13,1]]Let brotherly love continue.
[[He 13,2]]Do not neglect hospitality, for through it some have unknowingly entertained angels.
[[He 13,3]]Be mindful of prisoners as if sharing their imprisonment, and of the ill-treated as of yourselves, for you also are in the body.
[[He 13,4]]Let marriage be honored among all and the marriage bed be kept undefiled, for God will judge the immoral and adulterers.
[[He 13,5]]Let your life be free from love of money but be content with what you have, for he has said, "I will never forsake you or abandon you."
[[He 13,6]]Thus we may say with confidence: "The Lord is my helper, (and) I will not be afraid. What can anyone do to me?"
[[He 13,7]]Remember your leaders who spoke the word of God to you. Consider the outcome of their way of life and imitate their faith.
[[He 13,8]]Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, today, and forever.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
gospel.text:
[[Mc 6,14]]King Herod heard about Jesus, for his fame had become widespread, and people were saying, "John the Baptist has been raised from the dead; That is why mighty powers are at work in him."
[[Mc 6,15]]Others were saying, "He is Elijah"; still others, "He is a prophet like any of the prophets."
[[Mc 6,16]]But when Herod learned of it, he said, "It is John whom I beheaded. He has been raised up."
[[Mc 6,17]]Herod was the one who had John arrested and bound in prison on account of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip, whom he had married.
[[Mc 6,18]]John had said to Herod, "It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife."
[[Mc 6,19]]Herodias harbored a grudge against him and wanted to kill him but was unable to do so.
[[Mc 6,20]]Herod feared John, knowing him to be a righteous and holy man, and kept him in custody. When he heard him speak he was very much perplexed, yet he liked to listen to him.
[[Mc 6,21]]She had an opportunity one day when Herod, on his birthday, gave a banquet for his courtiers, his military officers, and the leading men of Galilee.
[[Mc 6,22]]Herodias's own daughter came in and performed a dance that delighted Herod and his guests. The king said to the girl, "Ask of me whatever you wish and I will grant it to you."
[[Mc 6,23]]He even swore (many things) to her, "I will grant you whatever you ask of me, even to half of my kingdom."
[[Mc 6,24]]She went out and said to her mother, "What shall I ask for?" She replied, "The head of John the Baptist."
[[Mc 6,25]]The girl hurried back to the king's presence and made her request, "I want you to give me at once on a platter the head of John the Baptist."
[[Mc 6,26]]The king was deeply distressed, but because of his oaths and the guests he did not wish to break his word to her.
[[Mc 6,27]]So he promptly dispatched an executioner with orders to bring back his head. He went off and beheaded him in the prison.
[[Mc 6,28]]He brought in the head on a platter and gave it to the girl. The girl in turn gave it to her mother.
[[Mc 6,29]]When his disciples heard about it, they came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.
